adobeApiEvent.shortdesc: Dispatched when a notification is received while the app is in the foreground

adobeApiEventDetail.apiDesc: Dispatched when a notification is received while the app is in the foreground

adobeApiEvent.shortdesc: Dispatched after an alert box showing a foreground notification is dismissed

adobeApiEventDetail.apiDesc: Dispatched after an alert box showing a foreground notification is dismissed

adobeApiEvent.shortdesc: Dispatched after a user clicked a notification they received while the app was in the background, causing the app to come to the foreground

adobeApiEventDetail.apiDesc: Dispatched after a user clicked a notification they received while the app was in the background, causing the app to come to the foreground

adobeApiEvent.shortdesc: Dispatched when a token or ID has failed to register with the server

adobeApiEventDetail.apiDesc: Dispatched when a token or ID has failed to register with the server

adobeApiEvent.shortdesc: Dispatched when a device token or ID has been successfully registered with the server

adobeApiEventDetail.apiDesc: Dispatched when a device token or ID has been successfully registered with the server

apiOperation.shortdesc: Dispatch RESUMED_FROM_NOTIFICATION events for any notifications that have not yet been dispatched.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Dispatch RESUMED_FROM_NOTIFICATION events for any notifications that have not yet been dispatched.
Starts registration for notifications. Use this to register at a later time if you initialized with autoRegister set to false.

adobeApiEvent.shortdesc: Dispatched when a notification is received while the app is in the foreground

adobeApiEventDetail.apiDesc: Dispatched when a notification is received while the app is in the foreground

adobeApiEvent.shortdesc: Dispatched after an alert box showing a foreground notification is dismissed

adobeApiEventDetail.apiDesc: Dispatched after an alert box showing a foreground notification is dismissed

adobeApiEvent.shortdesc: Dispatched after a user clicked a notification they received while the app was in the background, causing the app to come to the foreground

adobeApiEventDetail.apiDesc: Dispatched after a user clicked a notification they received while the app was in the background, causing the app to come to the foreground

adobeApiEvent.shortdesc: Dispatched when a token or ID has failed to register with the server

adobeApiEventDetail.apiDesc: Dispatched when a token or ID has failed to register with the server

adobeApiEvent.shortdesc: Dispatched when a device token or ID has been successfully registered with the server

adobeApiEventDetail.apiDesc: Dispatched when a device token or ID has been successfully registered with the server

apiOperation.shortdesc: Dispatch RESUMED_FROM_NOTIFICATION events for any notifications that have not yet been dispatched.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Dispatch RESUMED_FROM_NOTIFICATION events for any notifications that have not yet been dispatched.
Starts registration for notifications. Use this to register at a later time if you initialized with autoRegister set to false.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Sets tags to associate with the current user.

apiParam.apiDesc: set of key value String pairs

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Sets tags to associate with the current user. These should be key value String pairs.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Checks whether the current device is able to receive notifications.

apiReturn.apiDesc: true if notifications are available on the current device; false otherwise.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Checks whether the current device is able to receive notifications. This checks if the device is capable of receiving notifications, but not whether your specific app has been granted permissions to use notifications. For that, check areNotificationsEnabled().

apiOperation.shortdesc: Checks whether notifications have been allowed and enabled by the user, for your specific app.

apiReturn.apiDesc: true if the user has accepted notification receipt from your app

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Checks whether notifications have been allowed and enabled by the user, for your specific app. On iOS, this will be false until notifications have been initialized and the user has selected 'Allow Notifications' in the popup window. It will also be false if the user has retroactively disabled notifications for your app in the settings.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Initializes push notifications in manual mode.

apiReturn.apiDesc: the initialized manual controller instance. Afer calling initManual(), you can access it with EasyPush.manual.

apiParam.apiDesc: if targeting Android, your GCM Project Number
set to TRUE if you want the extension to automatically display a pop up dialog box when a push is received, while your app is running.
set to FALSE if you want to delay registration for a future call to registerForNotifications()

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
Initializes push notifications in manual mode. You can use this if you are running your own push notification handling server.
Call this as the very first thing in your app to ensure that notifications are received.

apiReturn.apiDesc: the initialized OneSignal controller instance. Afer calling initOneSignal(), you can access it with EasyPush.oneSignal.

apiParam.apiDesc: if targeting Android, your GCM Project Number
set to TRUE if you want the extension to automatically display a pop up dialog box when a push is received, while your app is running.
set to FALSE if you want to delay registration for a future call to registerForNotifications()

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
Initializes push notifications with OneSignal.
Call this as the very first thing in your app to ensure that notifications are received.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Check if the current device is running a platform supported by the extension (iOS or Android.) Check isSupported() before initializing the extension.

apiReturn.apiDesc: true if the current platform is supported by the extension.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Check if the current device is running a platform supported by the extension (iOS or Android.) Check isSupported() before initializing the extension. Note that this only determines whether the platform itself is supported by the extension, not whether they are enabled on the particular system.

apiValue.shortdesc: Get the current instance of the Manual push controller; you must call EasyPush.initManual() first.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Get the current instance of the Manual push controller; you must call EasyPush.initManual() first.

apiValue.shortdesc: Get the current instance of the OneSignal push controller; you must call EasyPush.initOneSignal() first.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Get the current instance of the OneSignal push controller; you must call EasyPush.initOneSignal() first.
